alert.note: Alert for Monroe Middle Keys; Monroe Upper Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued January 17 at 12:04PM EST until January 17 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Key West
info.description: * WHAT...Minor saltwater flooding expected to persist due to west to northwest winds piling water up within the Bayside communities. The Vaca Key National Ocean Service gauge continues to measure water levels one to one and a half feet above the predicted tide. * WHERE...Middle and Upper Florida Keys. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Minor saltwater flooding of low elevation streets and lots is likely. Some storm drains will overflow, and some seawalls and docks will be overtopped. Boaters can expect less clearance under fixed bridges. Motorists should remember that persistent puddles around the times of high tide are almost certain to contain a mix of saltwater.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Monroe Middle Keys; Monroe Upper Keys
